text: John Walter Rutherford (25 September 1929 â€“ 21 April 2022) was an Australian cricketer. He played in one Test match in 1956. Rutherford was the first player from the Western Australia cricket team to be picked for a senior cricket tour and the first to win a Test cap for Australia. He was born in Bruce Rock, Western Australia. Rutherford died on 21 April 2022, at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Australian cricketers Category:Sportspeople from Western Australia
title: Jack Rutherford (cricketer)
